title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 921-8.1 - Confidentiality of information obtained by the commissioner of labor
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 921-8.1 - Confidentiality of information obtained by the commissioner of labor

State Regulations
(a) Except as
otherwise provided in this subpart information obtained by the commissioner
through the administration of the Act from an employer and which is not
otherwise obtainable by the commissioner under the Labor Law or rules or
regulations promulgated thereunder shall: (1)
be confidential; and
(2)
not be
published or opened to public inspection. (b) Prior to public disclosure of any
information otherwise deemed confidential pursuant to this subpart in
connection with any court action or proceeding, the employer shall be given a
reasonable opportunity to make application to the court to protect the
information's confidentiality. (c) Names, addresses, and other personally identifiable information of employees
provided to the commissioner pursuant to Labor Law section 860-b and Subpart
921-2 of this Part shall remain confidential. (d) Notwithstanding the provisions set forth
in paragraphs (a) and (c) of this Subpart, information obtained by the
commissioner from the WARN notice required by the Act or this Part shall not be
considered confidential. (e) Nothing in this Subpart shall be construed to prohibit disclosure of
information that would otherwise be deemed confidential pursuant to this

Subpart where such information is used in the course of an enforcement action
or proceeding, including but not limited to an investigative conference
pursuant to subdivision (c) of section
921-7.1
of this Part or a
subsequent hearing. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
921-8.1

Amended

New

York State Register June 21, 2023/Volume XLV, Issue 25, eff. 6/21/2023

comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
